remarks: Strong property deduction for a norm.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 4-Oct-2015.)
statement:
nmpropd2.1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
nmpropd2.2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
nmpropd2.3 $e |- ( ph -> K e. Grp ) $.
nmpropd2.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
nmpropd2.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( dist ` K ) |` ( B X. B ) ) = ( ( dist ` L ) |` ( B X. B ) ) ) $.
nmpropd2 $p |- ( ph -> ( norm ` K ) = ( norm ` L ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d ph x y $.
